snippet.textDisplay:
Me encanta este TLoZ aunque aún no lo acabo xD lo acabaré algún día, pero por el momento tengo muchos juegos pendientes para terminar.

Este Zelda tiene un encanto que los demás no te dan. Me da la sensación de que es un cuento de hadas por toda la onda de los minish. Sin duda los juegos de diseño Toon son los más adorables <3

snippet.textDisplay: Underrated Zelda game. Although first time I played it I didn't like so much, but every other times I've played it I absolutely adored it.

snippet.textDisplay: Ame este juego demasiado <3 Vaati es un canijo extremadamente adorable xD y batalle un buen para derrotarlo al final!! cada ves que salia transformación tras transformación me dolía la cabeza xDD los minish en especial me gustaron bastante!! son tan lindos! en verdad de mis juegos fav de zelda c; *ezero i luv u*

snippet.textDisplay: One of those underrated Zelda games. It's not great in a few areas, but it has so much chaaaaaarm :s.
snippet.textOriginal: One of those underrated Zelda games. It's not great in a few areas, but it has so much chaaaaaarm :s.

snippet.textDisplay: I got this game recently at my local game store. If I wasn't in the middle of Oracle of Ages I'd totally be playing it right now.

snippet.textDisplay: Oracle of Ages? Way to throw a fuckton of nostalgia at us. xD

snippet.textDisplay:
no game will ever be as important for me, as this one... all the memories.
not only cause its the beginning of the timeline, where our hero receives his green cap, but also cause of the melodies and the retro style. oh my...  this soundtrack means so much to me :')

snippet.textDisplay: I started and i got stuck very fast -.-'
snippet.textOriginal: I started and i got stuck very fast -.-'

snippet.textDisplay:
that one temple you had to redo over and over and over and over every other hour just completely killed it for me.
It hat other flaws too, like the controls being extremely gimmicky just for the sake of it, weak story and one of the worst art design choices other than those just copy & pasted from WW. 
It had a few really creative moments in the regular dungeons, still it hasn't lived up even close to the expectations of a Wind Waker sequel.
snippet.textOriginal:
that one temple you had to redo over and over and over and over every other hour just completely killed it for me.
It hat other flaws too, like the controls being extremely gimmicky just for the sake of it, weak story and one of the worst art design choices other than those just copy & pasted from WW. 
It had a few really creative moments in the regular dungeons, still it hasn't lived up even close to the expectations of a Wind Waker sequel.

snippet.textDisplay: Ugh. Minish Cap is one of my least favorite Zeldas, possibly even lower on the totem pole than Twilight Princess, or maybe even Spirit Tracks.
snippet.textOriginal: Ugh. Minish Cap is one of my least favorite Zeldas, possibly even lower on the totem pole than Twilight Princess, or maybe even Spirit Tracks.

snippet.textDisplay:
Minish Cap got a lot of hate back when it came out, didn't it? Handheld Zeldas were always kind of weird, but it wasn't nearly such a trainwreck as Phantom Hourglass was. 
I liked it quite a bit.
snippet.textOriginal:
Minish Cap got a lot of hate back when it came out, didn't it? Handheld Zeldas were always kind of weird, but it wasn't nearly such a trainwreck as Phantom Hourglass was. 
I liked it quite a bit.

snippet.textDisplay: Even Navi waited for you to ask unless it was REALLY important.
snippet.textOriginal: Even Navi waited for you to ask unless it was REALLY important.

snippet.textDisplay: Indeed Mnish Cap is an underrated Zelda game, it had great music, well designed world and dungeons and unique equipment for Link. The only thing that really bothered me was the stupid over-tutorialization of the game: Like, you see a room, a switch, get the idea of which item to use and then Ezlo interrupts you to state the obvious and make you feel stupid. Why can't he wait for you to ask?
snippet.textOriginal: Indeed Mnish Cap is an underrated Zelda game, it had great music, well designed world and dungeons and unique equipment for Link. The only thing that really bothered me was the stupid over-tutorialization of the game: Like, you see a room, a switch, get the idea of which item to use and then Ezlo interrupts you to state the obvious and make you feel stupid. Why can't he wait for you to ask?

snippet.textDisplay: I think games like this showed the true beauty that pixel sprits are capable of. Hopefully even has handhelds move toward 3d renders the indie game market will keep the art alive for good.
snippet.textOriginal: I think games like this showed the true beauty that pixel sprits are capable of. Hopefully even has handhelds move toward 3d renders the indie game market will keep the art alive for good.

snippet.textDisplay: The good days of top down Zelda games, before stylus controls ruined everything.
snippet.textOriginal: The good days of top down Zelda games, before stylus controls ruined everything.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah, which is why I didn't mention Twilight Princess (awesome soundtrack). I was strictly talking about the handheld Zelda games that followed Minish Cap. Minegishi went for a completely different style on the DS since those games are lot more light hearted than TP, but the music ended up being very average save for a few standout tunes in Spirit Tracks.
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah, which is why I didn't mention Twilight Princess (awesome soundtrack). I was strictly talking about the handheld Zelda games that followed Minish Cap. Minegishi went for a completely different style on the DS since those games are lot more light hearted than TP, but the music ended up being very average save for a few standout tunes in Spirit Tracks.

snippet.textDisplay: Hey now... Toru Minegishi single-handedly composed most of Twilight Princess which is one of my favourite soundtracks of all time. His Zelda music is special to me at least.
snippet.textOriginal: Hey now... Toru Minegishi single-handedly composed most of Twilight Princess which is one of my favourite soundtracks of all time. His Zelda music is special to me at least.

snippet.textDisplay: I didn't realize the same guy did both DS Zeldas. Hourglass...bleh. The only Zelda I've never finished. Spirit Tracks is amazing though. The little things they changed in it made all the difference, especially in the central dungeon.
snippet.textOriginal: I didn't realize the same guy did both DS Zeldas. Hourglass...bleh. The only Zelda I've never finished. Spirit Tracks is amazing though. The little things they changed in it made all the difference, especially in the central dungeon.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hm, I may have to disagree about Spirit Tracks.  Had a bunch of memorable good beat songs that fit the game.  

Otherwise, I agree with your opinion.  Such a fun game and the music just helps enhance the experience.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh man, thanks for uploading this! My favourite 2D Zelda game and what a soundtrack. Mt. Crenel's theme is equally incredible.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember when I first went into﻿ the Minish Woods at the beginning of the game, I knew the soundtrack was in good hands. It's a short but memorable theme, just like Link to the Past's Lost Woods, which served﻿ as an inspiration (the high strings from 0:26 to 0:35 especially). I feel like Takano really understood what makes Zelda music so special, unlike Toru Minegishi who couldn't quite get away from his Animal Crossing sound in Phantom Hourglass and Spirit Tracks.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember when I first went into﻿ the Minish Woods at the beginning of the game, I knew the soundtrack was in good hands. It's a short but memorable theme, just like Link to the Past's Lost Woods, which served﻿ as an inspiration (the high strings from 0:26 to 0:35 especially). I feel like Takano really understood what makes Zelda music so special, unlike Toru Minegishi who couldn't quite get away from his Animal Crossing sound in Phantom Hourglass and Spirit Tracks.
